message.content:
cs.NE, cs.ET, cs.AR, cs.LG, cs.CV 

The paper discusses a learning framework for Spiking Neural Networks (SNNs) using crossbar arrays, which are commonly used in neuromorphic VLSI. This suggests that the paper could belong to the Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE) sub-category. Additionally, the paper discusses insights obtained from machine learning and computational neuroscience, which could place it in the Emerging Technologies (cs.ET) sub-category. The paper also presents simulations of a gesture recognition task, which could suggest that it belongs to the Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (cs.CV) sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the simplification of the circuit and suppression of fabrication mismatch, which could suggest that it belongs to the Logic in Computer Science (cs.LG) and Architecture (cs.AR) sub-categories, respectively.
